etc_nologin: Refuse logins to the system through /etc/nologin

etc_nologin.description: The content the /etc/nologin file should have.
etc_nologin.name: content

localuser_nologin: Refuse login privileges to specific users

localuser_nologin.name: list_of_users
localuser_nologin.description: List of users to be restricted from logging in.

bundle_descriptions.etc_nologin: If the file /etc/nologin exists and is readable, login(1) will allow access only to root. Other users will be shown the contents of this file and their logins will be refused.
bundle_descriptions.localuser_nologin: The nologin command displays a message that an account is not available and exits non-zero. It is intended as a replacement shell field for accounts that have been disabled.

metadata.description: This sketch provides facilities for restricing non root logins to a host.
metadata.name: Security::nologin
